Data Utilities¶

Serie Data¶

giotto.data.serie()¶

Create a new serie data object. Usage:

var data = [{name: 'foo', year, 2013, value: 5675},
            {name: 'gee', year, 2013, value: 3452545},
             ...];
var serie = giotto.data.serie().data(data);

serie.forEach(function (d) {

});
Returns:A new multi function
serie¶
serie.data([data])¶

Gets or sets the data to the specified array. If data is specified set the data and return the serie. If data is not specified return the current data array.

serie.x([x])¶

Gets or sets the x-accessor to the specified function or constant. If x is specified set the x-accessor and return the serie. If x is not specified return the current x-accessor.

serie.y([y])¶

Gets or sets the y-accessor to the specified function or constant. If y is specified set the y-accessor and return the serie. If y is not specified return the current x-accessor.

serie.label([label])¶

Gets or sets the label-accessor to the specified function or constant. If label is specified set the label-accessor and return the serie. If label is not specified return the current label-accessor.

serie.get(key)¶

Gets a value by key

Geometric Data¶

giotto.data.geo(features)¶

Create a new geo() data handler. Usage:

var g = giotto.data.geo(features);
Arguments:
  • features (array) – Array of geometric features to render
Returns:

A new geo function
geo(geodata)¶

Bind geodata to the geometric features available in this geometric data handler.

Arguments:
  • geodata (array) – an array data to bind to geometric features
Returns:

the
geo.value([value])¶
geo.data([data])¶

Set or get data associated with the geometric features of this handler When no arguments are available return the current data, otherwise set the new data as return geo().
